Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD; PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Sekhmet
Description: The inscription on the socle of this statuette tells us that the divinity represented is Sekhmet, wife of the Memphite god Ptah. Wearing a long tight-fitting dress in ptolemaic style, the goddess with the head of a lion wears a tripartite wig surmounted with a solar disk and a uraeus. Her big eyes and the large collar which covers her neck are inlaid with a precious metal. The usual attributes which the goddess holds in her hands,  that is to say the sign for life ankh and the wadj-sceptre, have disappeared.
